G.T.5359
SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON - 9th AUGUST, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT. The Battle between MORLANCOURT and MONTDIDIER is continuing violently. South-east of MORLANCOURT an enemy counter-attack has forced the British troops to give up part of the ground gained by them yesterday east of CHIPILLY.
South of the LUCE the French have made good progress, and have taken FRESNOY EN CHAUSSEE and have reached LE HAMEL and PIERREPONT on the AVRE. They are also reported to have captured QUESNEL.
The line now runs approximately as follows:- North of MORLANCOURT, high ground south of MORLANCOURT, west of CHIPILLY, MORCOURT, HARBONNIERES, CAIX, BEAUOOURT, East of FRESNOY EN CHAUSSEE, PLESSIERS-ROZAINVILLERS, PIERREPONT.
British cavalry have been in action east of HARBOHNIERES and CAIX. So far the captures are reported to be as follows:- by the British, 7,000 prisoners and over 100 guns, and by the French, 2,300 prisoners.
2. ITALIAN AND MACEDONIAN FRONTS.
There is no change in the general situation.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.l.
9th August, 1918.
Issued at 12.40 p.m.
